title: Jimmy J. Take a Holiday
story: This 15 by 11.5 intaglio piece is a portrait of one of Decker's favorite authors, James Joyce.

title: Pomergranate Lovers
story: A 8 by 10 inch color etching.

title: Untitled I
story: One of David's earlier works, showcasing his mastery of traditional painting techniques.

title: What is there to say?
story: A three-dimensional exploration of space and form, representing the artist's venture into sculpture.

title: Abstract Composition
story: Bold colors and dynamic forms showcase David's mature style and confident brushwork.

title: Opera in Vout
story: Bold colors and dynamic forms showcase David's mature style and confident brushwork.

title: Wapping Chronicle
story: A 22 inch by 30 inch intaglio.

title: The Scene is Clean
story: A 24 by 30 inch etching depicting a jazz guitarist - likely Wes Montgomery or Charlie Christian.

title: Krapp's Last Tub
story: This painted enamel plywood piece is a allusion to Krapp’s Last Tape (1958) a one-act play by Samuel Beckett, written for actor Patrick Magee and later considered one of Beckett’s major works. It portrays Krapp, an aging man, as he listens to recordings of his younger self reflecting on ambition, love, and loss, while making a new recording that reveals his bitterness and decline. The play explores themes of memory, regret, and the passage of time through the metaphor of tape recordings, set against stark imagery of light and dark.

title: Untitled II
story: Bold colors and dynamic forms showcase David's mature style and confident brushwork.

title: Untitled III
story: Bold colors and dynamic forms showcase David's mature style and confident brushwork.

title: Tubs - Tenors - Tunes
story: A surreal pencil drawing that blends dreamlike imagery with grotesque forms.

title: Just Desserts
story: Also called the 'Chef Bewitcher'. A 21 by 12 inch intaglio depeicting a chef rendered with dramatic shading, holding a symbolic object.

title: Untitled IV
story: A nocturnal scene where dogs and human figures emerge from stark black surroundings.

title: Orange
story: A vibrant painted wood relief depicting two swimmers in close embrace.

title: Untitled V
story: A portrait of a saxophonist in deep concentration, captured with intricate linework.

title: The Shootist
story: A cowboy with revolvers rendered in bold pencil lines, evoking classic Western imagery.

title: Untitled VI
story: A musician in formal attire holding a trumpet, etched with fine cross-hatching detail.

title: Untitled VII
story: Three women rendered in bold, colorful painting blending humor and warmth.

title: Untitled VIII
story: A lively party scene with dancers and musicians, depicted in layered wooden forms.

title: Untitled IX
story: A stark portrait of a man gazing upward, etched with dense texture and shading.

title: Men Moistening their Gums
story: A 40 inch by 30 inch intaglio etching. Two sharply dressed men with a dog and a jazz band in the background, rich with atmosphere.

title: Just Desserts II
story: A 16 inch by 12 inch intaglio. Expressive close-up portrait of a chef in a tall hat, defined by etched lines and tone.

title: Mercy H
story: Playful wooden reliefs of nude female figures, stylized with humor and bold colors.

title: Untitled X
story: A jazz pianist in concentrated profile, drawn with stippling and cross-hatched detail.

title: Untitled XI
story: A vibrant jazz scene with musicians in mid-performance, etched with lively strokes.

title: Billy Loves Lester
story: A 56 by 24 inch tall, elegant polychrome wood relief of depicting Billy Holiday in a black dress, accented with a white flower. The title hints at the friendship and collaboration between the two jazz musicians, Holiday and Lester Young. To read more about Billy and Lester please see this article here [Billie Holiday and Lester Young: the intimate friendship between Lady Day and Prez - The Guardian](https://www.theguardian.com/music/2015/apr/08/billie-holiday-and-lester-young-friendship-between-lady-day-and-prez)

title: The Cocktail Party
story: A lively dinner party scene with elegantly dressed figures gathered around a table. 48 inches by 96.

title: Moonscapes
story: A reclining nude figure blends seamlessly with a mountainous landscape under a yellow sky.

title: Molly Bloom's Dream
story: A 7 by 4 inch red-toned intaglio print juxtaposing reclining figures with abstract circular forms.

title: Untitled XII
story: A bold portrait of a woman mid-speech, defined by sharp contrasts and expressive lines.

title: Untitled XIII
story: A surreal bathroom scene where a figure plays saxophone in a tub surrounded by objects.

title: I think, I'll... Have some... Mashed Po-Ta-Toes
story: Three men in a kitchen — chefs and a soldier — rendered with textured etching lines.

title: Untitled XIV
story: A portrait of a man with glasses and pipe, composed within a circular frame.

title: Untitled XV
story: A pastoral scene of a shepherd with sheep, gazing across a vast patterned landscape.

title: The Winner of the Slow Bike Race
story: Expressive figure on a bicycle, rendered with strong use of color and gesture. 24 by 60 inches.

title: Mulli gan's Bath
story: Surreal imagery of faces and forms emerging from water.

title: Saint Sebastian
story: An abstract, red-toned composition of fragmented forms.

title: Major Parts
story: Annotated surreal portrait with humorous and absurd text elements.

title: Beachette
medium: Intaglio print on paper with hand-coloring
story: A 18 by 36 inch etching depicting two figures locked in a raw, emotional embrace, accented with color.

title: Vico's Dreams
story: A 30 by 18 inch black and white lithograph. Portrait of two figures, rendered with strong cross-hatching and dramatic hand gestures.

title: Merci, Humpee Sue La Plage
story: A 24 inch by 39 unch color lithograph. A contemplative figure in swimwear set against a sparse seascape.

title: Youth's Magic Horn
story: A 9 inch by 7 inch intaglio piece. Playful and surreal picnic-like gathering under a tree, featuring musicians and champagne.

title: Krapp's Last Tub II
story: A 20 by 26 inch etching. Another allustion to the Beckett play 'Krapp's Last Stand'.

title: Untitled XVI
story: Playful and surreal picnic-like gathering under a tree, featuring musicians and champagne.
